instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
threads.message:
The customer tried to change the battery and after that, it stays at the logo.

I have tried to boot from an external hard drive/pendrive and they never fully load.

Any suggestion?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
threads.message:
Did you connect back original battery?
At least try disconnecting new battery; chinese crap may cause weird issues.

Did you resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>?
You can also try disabling GPU, just in case; easy to do on this model.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
threads.message:
Yes, I tried with an original battery but it does the same thing.

Instead of resoldering it, I changed it.
I haven't tried disabling the gpu.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
threads.message: Run corresponding ASD; OS version can test GPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
threads.message: I have disabled the GPU and now it starts OK: GPU is damaged?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
